001package io.github.ai4ci.abm.riskmodel;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006import org.slf4j.Logger;
007import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
008
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Contact;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelNav;
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
012import io.github.ai4ci.abm.TestResult;
013import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
014
015/**
016 * Bayesian risk estimation model for determining individual infectious
017 * probability.
018 *
019 * <h2>Overview</h2>
020 * <p>
021 * Establishes an individual's risk on a given day. Risk on a given day is a
022 * function of the day of contact and the day on which the risk is estimated
023 * (usually this is going to be now). The risk is based on both direct evidence
024 * from tests and symptoms and indirect evidence from contacts. Because results
025 * from tests are delayed and symptoms evolve over time the risk has to be
026 * recalculated every day, as new information emerges about the index person but
027 * also about their contacts.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * For example given a contact on day X, if the exposer develops symptoms on day
031 * X+1 (and reports them) then the risk to the exposee as calculated on day X+1
032 * will be more than on day X. Because of this there is a limited amount you can
033 * pre-calculate as the answer will depend on observations that may or may not
034 * have happened yet. What we can calculate is what the results of symptoms
035 * today mean for contacts in the past and how tests taken today impact risk to
036 * contacts in the past.
037 *
038 * <p>
039 * This model calculates an individual's risk of being infectious on a given day
040 * based on:
041 * <ul>
042 * <li>Direct evidence: symptoms and test results through time</li>
043 * <li>Indirect evidence: contact tracing and exposure history</li>
044 * </ul>
045 *
046 * <p>
047 * The risk evolves over time as new information becomes available. Calculations
048 * follow Bayesian updating principles with log-odds formulations for
049 * computational stability.
050 *
051 * <h2>Bayesian Framework</h2>
052 * <p>
053 * Risk is calculated using Bayes' theorem with log-odds transformation: \[
054 * \text{posterior odds} = \text{prior odds} \times \text{likelihood ratio} \]
055 * In log-odds space this becomes: \[
056 * \log\left(\frac{p}{1-p}\right)_{\text{posterior}} =
057 * \log\left(\frac{p}{1-p}\right)_{\text{prior}} + \log(\text{likelihood ratio})
058 * \]
059 *
060 * <h2>Evidence Sources</h2>
061 * <p>
062 * The model uses three types of convolution filters to weight evidence over
063 * time:
064 * <ul>
065 * <li><b>Symptom Kernel</b>: Temporal weighting of symptom reporting</li>
066 * <li><b>Test Kernel</b>: Temporal weighting of test results including
067 * delays</li>
068 * <li><b>Contacts Kernel</b>: Temporal weighting of exposure risk from
069 * contacts</li>
070 * </ul>
071 *
072 * <h2>Temporal Evolution</h2>
073 * <p>
074 * Evidence accumulation follows a dynamic programming approach where: \[
075 * \mathbf{logOdds}_{t} = f(\mathbf{logOdds}_{t-1}, \text{new evidence}_t) \]
076 * Each day's risk estimate incorporates both new evidence and re-evaluation of
077 * past evidence in light of new developments.
078 */
079@Value.Immutable
080public interface RiskModel extends Serializable {
081
082        /** Logger for debugging and tracing risk model calculations */
083        public Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(RiskModel.class);
084
085        /**
086         * Probability of reporting symptoms when symptomatic (app compliance). This
087         * represents reporting sensitivity through symptom reporting mechanisms.
088         * <p>
089         * This is 1 here because the symptoms are only recorded if the person has
090         * already been tested as compliant and is symptomatic. It is still possible
091         * if compliant that the person won't report negative symptoms in which case
092         * the absence of symptoms is not informative. The whole risk model is very
093         * sensitive to these values along with the kernels
094         */
095        double PROB_REPORTING_POSITIVE_SYMPTOMS = 1;
096
097        /**
098         * Probability of symptom absence being reported when asymptomatic.
099         * Represents the specificity of symptom absence reporting.
100         */
101        double PROB_REPORTING_NEGATIVE_SYMPTOMS = 0.02;
102
103        /**
104         * Initialize a new risk model for a person with configured convolution
105         * kernels.
106         *
107         * <p>
108         * Sets up temporal weighting functions from execution configuration: -
109         * Symptom kernel: \(K_{\text{symptom}}(t)\) - Test kernel:
110         * \(K_{\text{test}}(t)\) - Contacts kernel: \(K_{\text{contacts}}(t) /
111         * \text{expectedContacts}\)
112         *
113         * @param person the individual to model
114         * @return initialized risk model ready for evidence accumulation
115         */
116        static RiskModel initialise(Person person) {
117                var config = ModelNav.modelParam(person);
118                var meanContacts = ModelNav.modelBase(person)
119                                .getExpectedContactsPerPersonPerDay();
120                return ImmutableRiskModel.builder().setEntity(person)
121                                .setTime(
122                                                person.getOutbreak().getCurrentState() == null ? 0
123                                                                : person.getOutbreak().getCurrentState().getTime()
124                                )
125                                .setSymptomKernel(
126                                                ConvolutionFilter.from(config.getRiskModelSymptomKernel())
127                                )
128                                .setTestKernel(
129                                                ConvolutionFilter.from(config.getRiskModelTestKernel())
130                                )
131                                .setContactsKernel(
132                                                ConvolutionFilter.from(config.getRiskModelContactsKernel())
133                                                                .scale(1 / meanContacts)
134                                ).build();
135        }
136
137        /**
138         * Shift evidence array one day forward, adding today's slot at index 0. Past
139         * evidence beyond maxLength is truncated. This is only possible for direct
140         * evidence as indirect evidence is recalculated each day.
141         *
142         * @param old previous day's evidence array
143         * @return new array with updated timing
144         */
145        private double[] copyOf(double[] old) {
146                var len = Math.min(old.length + 1, this.getMaxLength());
147                var out = new double[len];
148                for (var i = 1; i < out.length; i++) {
149                        out[i] = old[i - 1];
150                }
151                return out;
152        }
153
154        /**
155         * The contacts kernel is used to weight the contribution of past contacts to
156         * current risk. It determines how much influence a contact from a given day
157         * in the past has on today's risk estimate. The kernel should be calibrated
158         * based on the typical incubation period and infectiousness profile of the
159         * disease, as well as the expected delay in symptom onset and test results.
160         * The kernel values should be non-negative and typically sum to 1 for
161         * interpretability, but this is not strictly required as long as the
162         * relative weights are meaningful.
163         *
164         * @return convolution filter for contact exposure evidence weighting
165         */
166        @Value.Redacted
167        ConvolutionFilter getContactsKernel();
168
169        /**
170         * Array of direct log-odds evidence for infectiousness on past days. Index 0
171         * represents today, increasing indices represent further in the past.
172         * Calculated as:
173         * \[\log\left(\frac{p(\text{infectious}|evidence)}{1-p(\text{infectious}|evidence)}\right)\]
174         *
175         * <p>
176         * What is this evidence of this person being infectious 0..N days in the
177         * past judged today expressed as a log odds, based on symptoms and test
178         * results that are available today.
179         *
180         * @return array of log-odds evidence for infectiousness on past days, where
181         *         index 0 is today
182         */
183        @Value.Default
184        default double[] getDirectLogOdds() { return new double[0]; }
185
186        /**
187         * Retrieve direct log-odds evidence for a specific past day.
188         *
189         * @param i days in the past (0 = today, 1 = yesterday, etc.)
190         * @return log-odds evidence for infectiousness on that day
191         */
192        default double getDirectLogOddsInPast(int i) {
193                if (i < 0 || i >= this.getDirectLogOdds().length) { return 0; }
194                return this.getDirectLogOdds()[i];
195        }
196
197        /**
198         * The subject
199         *
200         * @return the person entity associated with this risk model
201         */
202        Person getEntity();
203
204        /**
205         * Indirect log-odds from contact exposures.
206         *
207         * <p>
208         * Calculates risk contribution from contact tracing: \[ LR_{\text{indirect}}
209         * = \sum_{i=0}^{N_{\text{contacts}}}
210         * \sum_{\text{contact}\in\text{contacts}_i} LR_{\text{contact}}(i) \times
211         * K_{\text{contacts}}(i) \]
212         *
213         * <p>
214         * Unlike direct evidence, contact risk is recalculated daily rather than
215         * updated incrementally, as contact risk evolves with changing contact
216         * states. What will the evidence be for this person being infectious today
217         * as a result of their past contacts. This value is would change
218         * retrospectively if you estimated it again the next day as the contacts
219         * test results and symptoms change. However this is only useful information
220         * if we are interested in contacts of contacts. We are no so we do the
221         * simpler thing which is look at recent contacts and get an estimate for
222         * today only.
223         *
224         * @return log-likelihood ratio from contact exposures
225         */
226        @Value.Lazy
227        default double getIndirectLogOdds() {
228                // double[] newer = new double[getMaxLength()];
229
230                var contacts = this.getContactsKernel();
231
232                // old contacts inform new time points, but old contacts change also.
233                // Unlike symptoms and tests we don't get new information about the
234                // contacts but the information value of each contact changes. This
235                // means we can't update the old value in the same way, and we
236                // basically have to recalculate it each time. If we wanted to do this
237                // retrospectively we would have to check every contact for every past
238                // day which would be expensive.
239
240                // This is only really useful if we are actually using historical
241                // indirect log odds to inform a contact. So for that to be useful
242                // we need to be considering if the contacts of an indirect contact are
243                // informative in addition to the tests / symptoms of a direct contact.
244                // This seems unlikely to be beneficial.
245
246                // What we are actually doing instead is getting a single value for the
247                // most up to date contacts. This value is only right for the point in
248                // time at which it is calculated.
249
250                var logOdds = 0D;
251
252                for (var i = 0; i < contacts.retrospectiveSize(); i++) {
253                        var ph = this.getEntity().getHistory(i);
254                        final var density = contacts.getDensity(i);
255                        if (ph.isPresent()) {
256                                for (Contact c : ph.get().getTodaysContacts()) {
257                                        try {
258                                                if (c.isDetected()) {
259                                                        logOdds += c.getParticipantState(ph.get()).getRiskModel()
260                                                                        .getDirectLogOddsInPast(i) *
261                                                        // c.getProximityDuration() *
262                                                                        density;
263                                                }
264                                        } catch (NullPointerException e) {
265                                                log.error(
266                                                                "Persistent null pointer in contact network detected"
267                                                );
268                                        }
269                                }
270                        }
271                }
272
273                return logOdds;
274        }
275
276        /**
277         * Log-odds of infectiousness today relative to baseline population
278         * prevalence.
279         *
280         * <p>
281         * Represents the combined evidence from direct measurements and contact
282         * exposures: \[ LR_{\text{total}} = LR_{\text{direct}}(0) +
283         * LR_{\text{indirect}} \]
284         * <p>
285         * What is the longest it is worth holding information about infection risk
286         * for? The contacts kernel retrospectiveSize is one sensible limit. Beyond
287         * that there is no value to the information anyway for determining future
288         * risk. Is this
289         *
290         * @return combined log-likelihood ratio for infectiousness today
291         */
292        @Value.Lazy
293        default double getLogOddsInfectiousToday() {
294                return this.getDirectLogOddsInPast(0) + this.getIndirectLogOdds();
295        }
296
297        /**
298         * Maximum temporal window for evidence retention.
299         *
300         * <p>
301         * Determined by the largest retrospective size among the convolution
302         * kernels: \[ \text{maxLength} =
303         * \max(\text{symptomKernel.retrospectiveSize},
304         * \text{testKernel.retrospectiveSize},
305         * \text{contactsKernel.retrospectiveSize}) \]
306         *
307         * @return maximum number of days to retain evidence
308         */
309        @Value.Derived
310        default int getMaxLength() {
311                return Math.max(
312                                Math.max(
313                                                this.getContactsKernel().retrospectiveSize(),
314                                                this.getSymptomKernel().retrospectiveSize()
315                                ), this.getTestKernel().retrospectiveSize()
316                );
317        }
318
319        /**
320         * Probability of being infectious today, incorporating all available
321         * evidence.
322         *
323         * <p>
324         * Calculated using Bayesian updating with logistic transformation: \[
325         * p_{\text{infectious}} =
326         * \text{expit}\left(\log\left(\frac{p_{\text{prior}}}{1-p_{\text{prior}}}\right)
327         * + LR_{\text{direct}} + LR_{\text{indirect}}\right) \] where
328         * \(\text{expit}(x) = \frac{e^x}{1 + e^x}\) is the logistic function.
329         *
330         * <p>
331         * Uses a small prior (0.0025) to prevent numerical issues with extreme
332         * log-odds.
333         *
334         * @return probability of infectiousness today âˆˆ [0,1]
335         */
336        @Value.Lazy
337        default double getProbabilityInfectiousToday() {
338                var prior = 0.0025;
339                // double prior = 0.5;
340                // double prior =
341                // getEntity().getOutbreak().getCurrentState().getPresumedTestPositivePrevalence();
342                // double prior = getEntity().getCurrentHistory().map(p ->
343                // p.getPresumedLocalPrevalence()).orElse(0.0001);
344                return Conversions.expit(
345                                Conversions.logit(prior) + this.getDirectLogOddsInPast(0)
346                                                + this.getIndirectLogOdds()
347                );
348        }
349
350        /**
351         * The symptom kernel is used to weight the contribution of symptom evidence
352         * over time. It determines how much influence symptoms reported on a given
353         * day in the past have on today's risk estimate. The kernel should be
354         * calibrated based on the typical incubation period and symptom onset
355         * profile of the disease, as well as the expected delay in symptom
356         * reporting. The kernel values should be non-negative and typically sum to 1
357         * for interpretability, but this is not strictly required as long as the
358         * relative weights are meaningful.
359         *
360         * @return convolution filter for symptom evidence weighting
361         */
362        @Value.Redacted
363        ConvolutionFilter getSymptomKernel();
364
365        /**
366         * The test kernel is used to weight the contribution of test evidence over
367         * time, accounting for delays in test results. It determines how much
368         * influence a test result from a given day in the past has on today's risk
369         * estimate, based on the typical delay from testing to result and the
370         * temporal profile of test sensitivity. The kernel should be calibrated
371         * based on the expected distribution of test result delays and the
372         * sensitivity profile of the tests used in the simulation. The kernel values
373         * should be non-negative and typically sum to 1 for interpretability, but
374         * this is not strictly required as long as the relative weights are
375         * meaningful.
376         *
377         * @return convolution filter for test evidence weighting
378         */
379        @Value.Redacted
380        ConvolutionFilter getTestKernel();
381
382        /**
383         * Simulation time
384         *
385         * @return current simulation time step
386         */
387        int getTime();
388
389        /**
390         * Calculate symptom log-likelihood ratio for Bayesian updating.
391         *
392         * <p>
393         * For symptomatic reports: \[ LR_{\text{symptom}} =
394         * \log\left(\frac{\text{sensitivity}}{1 - \text{specificity}}\right) \times
395         * P_{\text{report}} \]
396         *
397         * <p>
398         * For asymptomatic reports: \[ LR_{\text{no-symptom}} = \log\left(\frac{1 -
399         * \text{sensitivity}}{\text{specificity}}\right) \times P_{\text{no-report}}
400         * \]
401         *
402         * @param isKnownSymptomatic whether symptoms were reported
403         * @return log-likelihood ratio for infectiousness given symptom evidence
404         */
405        private double symptomLogLik(boolean isKnownSymptomatic) {
406                // At the moment this is not adjusted for the probability of app usage
407                var sens = ModelNav.modelState(this.getEntity())
408                                .getPresumedSymptomSensitivity();
409                var spec = ModelNav.modelState(this.getEntity())
410                                .getPresumedSymptomSpecificity();
411                // Assume that the app only knows about positive symptoms, and not all
412                // positive symptoms reported.
413                return isKnownSymptomatic ?
414                // Value of a symptom
415                                Math.log(sens / (1 - spec)) * PROB_REPORTING_POSITIVE_SYMPTOMS :
416                                // Value of a not reported symptom? could be 0D;
417                                // If symptoms
418                                Math.log((1 - sens) / (spec)) * PROB_REPORTING_NEGATIVE_SYMPTOMS;
419        }
420
421        /**
422         * Update risk model to current day with new evidence.
423         *
424         * Update the risk model to the current day, based on the current state of
425         * the person. (The risk model is most likely immutable so this will be a new
426         * one). This is called during the update cycle at the point that the history
427         * is updated..
428         * <p>
429         * Performs one step of temporal Bayesian filtering: \[ \mathbf{evidence}_{t}
430         * = \text{update}(\mathbf{evidence}_{t-1}, \text{observations}_t) \]
431         *
432         * <p>
433         * Called during the daily update cycle when new history becomes available.
434         *
435         * @return updated risk model with incremented time and new evidence
436         *         incorporated
437         */
438        default RiskModel update() {
439                var tmp = ImmutableRiskModel.builder().from(this);
440                tmp.setDirectLogOdds(this.updateDirectLogOdds(this.getDirectLogOdds()))
441                                .setTime(this.getTime() + 1);
442                return tmp.build();
443        }
444
445        /**
446         * Update direct log-odds evidence with new information from today.
447         *
448         * <p>
449         * Implements a temporal Bayesian filter that: 1. Shifts previous evidence
450         * forward in time 2. Incorporates new symptom evidence using symptom kernel
451         * convolution 3. Incorporates new test evidence using test kernel
452         * convolution
453         *
454         * Logic here is complex. We are updating what we know about the past given
455         * the extra information that becomes available today. The old directLogOdds
456         * array is 0..N days in the past from yesterday. We shift this one
457         * additional day and set todays directLogOdds to 0 using copyOf
458         *
459         * <p>
460         * Symptom evidence convolution: \[ LR_{\text{new}}[0] +=
461         * \sum_{i=0}^{N_{\text{retro}}} \text{symptomLR}(i) \times
462         * K_{\text{symptom}}(i) \] \[ LR_{\text{new}}[j] +=
463         * \sum_{j=1}^{N_{\text{prosp}}} \text{symptomLR}(today) \times
464         * K_{\text{symptom}}(-j) \]
465         *
466         * <p>
467         * Test evidence follows similar convolution patterns accounting for result
468         * delays.
469         *
470         * @param old previous day's evidence array
471         * @return updated evidence array incorporating today's information
472         */
473        private double[] updateDirectLogOdds(double[] old) {
474
475                // the old state accounts for information from symptoms up to last time
476                // point and we can reuse that (since results are not updated in this
477                // model).
478                var newer = this.copyOf(old);
479                // Additional information from symptoms today:
480                var symptoms = this.getSymptomKernel();
481
482                // old symptoms inform new time point (today). the symptoms are relevant
483                // up
484                // to the size of the future part of the kernel. Todays symptoms also
485                // included here
486                // This is all updating index 0 of the array
487                for (var i = 0; i < symptoms.retrospectiveSize(); i++) {
488                        var ph = this.getEntity().getHistory(i);
489                        final var density = symptoms.getDensity(i);
490                        if (ph.isPresent()) {
491                                newer[0] += this.symptomLogLik(ph.get().isReportedSymptomatic())
492                                                * density;
493                        }
494                }
495
496                // todays symptom state informs past time points, todays results inform
497                // old time points up to past part of the kernel
498                // this is updating indices 1..N of the array
499                {
500                        var ph = this.getEntity().getCurrentHistory();
501                        if (ph.isPresent()) {
502                                var maxIndex = Math
503                                                .min(newer.length - 1, symptoms.prospectiveSize());
504                                for (var i = 1; i <= maxIndex; i++) {
505                                        newer[i] += this.symptomLogLik(ph.get().isReportedSymptomatic())
506                                                        * symptoms.getDensity(-i);
507                                }
508                        }
509                }
510
511                // Tests are harder. The tests taken today will only become informative
512                // when the result is available. When the result is available it will
513                // inform the period around the test sample date.
514                // we do this as before in two stages. all previous tests and how they
515                // inform today.
516                var tests = this.getTestKernel();
517                for (var i = 0; i < tests.retrospectiveSize(); i++) {
518                        var ph = this.getEntity().getHistory(i);
519                        var density = tests.getDensity(i);
520                        final var tmpI = i;
521                        if (ph.isPresent()) {
522                                // on day i in the past there were tests taken.
523                                for (TestResult tr : ph.get().getTodaysTests()) {
524                                        // the information value of that test depends on the time
525                                        // delay, while the result is pending
526                                        // tests taken today with no delay should be included here.
527                                        // e.g. LFTs
528                                        newer[0] += tr.logLikelihoodRatio(tmpI) * density;
529                                }
530                        }
531                }
532
533                // OK what do todays results tell us about the past?
534
535                {
536                        var ph = this.getEntity().getCurrentHistory();
537                        if (ph.isPresent()) {
538                                for (TestResult tr : ph.get().getTodaysResults()) {
539                                        // for a given test result delayed by 3 days with a kernel
540                                        // with max past size of 7 days
541                                        // a positive result influences everything up to the past size
542                                        // of the kernel plus the delay (from 1 to 10 days in the past).
543                                        var maxIndex = Math.min(
544                                                        newer.length - 1,
545                                                        tests.prospectiveSize() + (int) tr.getDelay()
546                                        );
547                                        for (var i = 1; i <= maxIndex; i++) {
548                                                // The kernel offset has to be calculated such that the
549                                                // delay is accounted for.
550                                                var offset = (int) tr.getDelay() - i;
551                                                newer[i] += tr.trueLogLikelihoodRatio()
552                                                                * symptoms.getDensity(offset);
553                                        }
554                                }
555                        }
556                }
557
558                return newer;
559        }
560
561}
